channel.title: Ideas for a project
channel.description: I was just wondering if anyone had a project idea for me to do in JAVA, it must be based in the cmd though :P I just need something to test my skills, and see what I need to work on.

item.title: Ideas for a project

item.title: Ideas for a project
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:11, topic:424705”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=527368.msg3844572#msg3844572 date=1323531496]
If I made it in java it would have to be cmd based, and I got it in visual basic to like almost completed until I realized I fucked up half way through XD I am still going to make it in Vb, as it seems easier.
[/quote]

Then why the fuck did you ask for projects in Java, if you were going to disregard our suggestions, and do it in a piss-poor language like VB?

Also, nothing restricts Java to being solely command-line based. Look into AWT and Swing.

The only reason you want to do it in VB is because it’s drag and drop. There are drag and drop Swing Application creators out there you skid.[/quote]
I decided to use Vb for the idea The Outsider gave me, not for my java project, I am learning java 2d and java 3d atm, so gtfo off me faggot.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a project
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:11, topic:424705”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=527368.msg3844572#msg3844572 date=1323531496]
If I made it in java it would have to be cmd based, and I got it in visual basic to like almost completed until I realized I fucked up half way through XD I am still going to make it in Vb, as it seems easier.
[/quote]

Then why the fuck did you ask for projects in Java, if you were going to disregard our suggestions, and do it in a piss-poor language like VB?

Also, nothing restricts Java to being solely command-line based. Look into AWT and Swing.

The only reason you want to do it in VB is because it’s drag and drop. There are drag and drop Swing Application creators out there you skid.[/quote]if he prefers visual basic, why ruin his fun. yes, it’s a shit language but he wants RAD and probably knows it better than Java and so can accomplish what he wants faster, and considering it’s a request of sort that’s a good thing. i don’t think he’s specified he wants to learn anything really, he just said he’s testing his skills. if he was learning, yeah, using java would be a better idea.

Read full topic

tyb97:

If I made it in java it would have to be cmd based, and I got it in visual basic to like almost completed until I realized I fucked up half way through XD I am still going to make it in Vb, as it seems easier.

Then why the fuck did you ask for projects in Java, if you were going to disregard our suggestions, and do it in a piss-poor language like VB?

Also, nothing restricts Java to being solely command-line based. Look into AWT and Swing.

The only reason you want to do it in VB is because it’s drag and drop. There are drag and drop Swing Application creators out there you skid.

item.title: Ideas for a project
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“pk2play, post:7, topic:424705”]Have fun.
http://uppit.com/907jfi83x4de/Dialogue_Creator.rar[/quote]
I tried to reply to your PM but your inbox was full. I basically was going to say no I don’t work with PI, and that I want to create my own in which the Strings fit perfectly on the interface (automatically) and is compatible with more than one source (Hyperion etc.).

I also want the user to have to specify their method so the program can generate all the dialogue at a copy and paste level.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a project
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

tyb97:

Ahh sounds very nice, I might just make this in Visual Basic for the use of a gui

Create it in Java.

[quote=“The Outsider, post:2, topic:424705”]A program where a user can input their format of dialogue methods for their server (just the once), and then type up some dialogue that outputs the dialogue inside the method, with nextDialogues.

The lines should fit perfectly on the interface (you will have to count the characters) and have it create a new String if the char count exceeds this.

If you don’t I will. :)[/quote]

Scanner.

Read full topic

item.description:

Awesome, I would like to use/test this out if you manage to get far. Maybe support 3 or 4 popular bases to start with? I was thinking PI, Delta, Hyperion’s XML and some other source.

It only has to dump the code for a copy and paste.

item.title: Ideas for a project
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

A program where a user can input their format of dialogue methods for their server (just the once), and then type up some dialogue that outputs the dialogue inside the method, with nextDialogues.

The lines should fit perfectly on the interface (you will have to count the characters) and have it create a new String if the char count exceeds this.

If you don’t I will.

Read full topic
